question_and_answer_pairs.question: What is ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
question_and_answer_pairs.answer: ComfyUI PhotoMaker is an unofficial implementation of the PhotoMaker project for ComfyUI, allowing users to generate images and videos using a stable diffusion model.

question_and_answer_pairs.question: What features are included in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
question_and_answer_pairs.answer: Features include base model loading, PhotoMaker Adapter model loading, reference image preprocessing, Lora model loading, prompt + style, and PhotoMaker generation.

question_and_answer_pairs.question: How can I install ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
question_and_answer_pairs.answer: You can manually install ComfyUI PhotoMaker by running commands cd custom_nodes, git clone https://github.com/ZHO-ZHO-ZHO/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker.git, cd custom_nodes/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker, pip install -r requirements.txt, and then restarting ComfyUI.

question_and_answer_pairs.question: What are the supported styles in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
question_and_answer_pairs.answer: The supported styles in ComfyUI PhotoMaker include no style, cinematic, Disney character, digital art, photographic (default), fantasy art, neonpunk, enhance, comic book, lowpoly, and line art.

question_and_answer_pairs.question: What are the supported file formats for the reference images in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
question_and_answer_pairs.answer: The reference images can be any image format that is supported by the operating system and the used programming library, as image pre-processing only requires the image to be read and possibly resized. Direct input can be done using a single image file path, and the software will automatically select the first file it encounters. Path input means to place the images to generate within a directory.

question_and_answer_pairs.question: What is the default guidance scale in ComfyUI PhotoMaker?
question_and_answer_pairs.answer: The default guidance scale in ComfyUI PhotoMaker is 5.
